subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: John Calvin and Predestination
description: A fast breakdown of John Calvin and Predestination for builders.

hook.text: God already chose who goes to heaven. You can't earn it or lose it. Calvin's idea was terrifying â€” and revolutionary.

buildup.text: John Calvin, based in Geneva, argued that God predestines every soul before birth. Free will is an illusion.

discovery.text: If you're chosen, you'll show it through moral living and hard work. Success became a sign of God's favor.

twist.text: Max Weber argued Calvinist work ethic created capitalism. The Protestant drive to prove election fueled enterprise.

climax.text: Calvin's Geneva was a theocracy: religious law governed daily life. He proved Protestantism could be as strict as Rome.

punchline.text: Calvin said God chose you before birth. That idea helped build capitalism.

quiz.question: What is predestination?
options: The idea that humans choose their own fate
The belief that God pre-selects who will be saved
